title: CARVING Our Own History
body_text:
East Coast Dodgeball
THANKSKILLING
was the incredible 195th event produced within the second
Tronolone Era
. As per annual tradition, Thanksgiving Saturday - November 24 - was selected as the host date.
THANKSKILLING will most likely be remembered for
ECD
's long-awaited return to the Wall High School battlezone. Since late-July 2012, the courts received massive reconstruction efforts until their completion at the end of September.
MAIN ATTRACTION
The
alphebetic team selection process
initially witnessed at OCTOBERFEST the previous month returned, only this time with an added twist. Players at the tail-end of the line merged together; the duos were then divided into the two formidible squads seen at THANKSKILLING:
◘ TEAM #1: Alex Brummel, Eamon Fitzpatrick, Justin Pierce, Kelly Oberto, Kevin Fitzpatrick, Lauren Stopa, Michael Edwards, Zach Katz.
◘ TEAM #2: Ben Cotta, Jason Teitelbaum, John Tronolone, Justin Wolf, Kevin Adams, Kevin Megill, Matt Tangel, Tom Adams
While no hype preceded the PrisonBall encounter, it was undoubtedly one of the finest athletic displays of 2012. It was so good in fact that there 3 lead changes during the total 11 games. Keeping in mind the already established groups, the addition of late arrivals Brent Bitsko, Charlie Podesta, Michael "Sputz" Krott, Grant Cornero, Tim Hart, and Diana DiBuccio sprinkled some extra seasoning onto this holiday treat.
Rounds 3, 5, 6, and 7 belonged to the first formed army; but "deuce" was wild, literally and figuratively, as games 1, 2, 4, 8, 9, 10, and 11 were captured by the victorious TEAM #2.
It's really no wonder
ECD
continues this yearly feast - everyone just yearns for that great taste of dodgeball!
TURKEY RECORDS
In all, there were a solid
23 competitors
at THANKSKILLING, a turnout comprised of 19 men and 4 women. Matt Tangel was the only new participant; he received #506 as his player code number. Welcome to the big leagues, Matt!
2012 Year-end Statistics
◘ 23.2 average participants
◘ 21 new players, including #500 at SEVEN: THE ANNIVERSARY
◘ An average of 18.2 male and 4.7 female combatants per event
◘ Three venues for the first time ever - Wall High School, Ocean Road Park, and Orchard Park
THANKS"KILLING" History
History is no mystery especially on this cherished weekend. The Thanksgiving Holiday always brings out the best, and then some. Don't believe it? Check these out -
2005 | ORP One More Time
2006 | The Dark Days Have Begun
2007 | Wall, All 4
2008 | Megill, Adams II
2009 | Adams Era Feast-Off
2010 | Wall, All 11
2011 | Final Destination
________________________________________
___________________
ONLINE EXCLUSIVE!
body_html:
East Coast Dodgeball THANKSKILLING was the incredible 195th event produced within the second Tronolone Era. As per annual tradition, Thanksgiving Saturday - November 24 - was selected as the host date.

THANKSKILLING will most likely be remembered for ECD's long-awaited return to the Wall High School battlezone. Since late-July 2012, the courts received massive reconstruction efforts until their completion at the end of September.

MAIN ATTRACTION
The alphebetic team selection process initially witnessed at OCTOBERFEST the previous month returned, only this time with an added twist. Players at the tail-end of the line merged together; the duos were then divided into the two formidible squads seen at THANKSKILLING:

◘ TEAM #1: Alex Brummel, Eamon Fitzpatrick, Justin Pierce, Kelly Oberto, Kevin Fitzpatrick, Lauren Stopa, Michael Edwards, Zach Katz.
◘ TEAM #2: Ben Cotta, Jason Teitelbaum, John Tronolone, Justin Wolf, Kevin Adams, Kevin Megill, Matt Tangel, Tom Adams

While no hype preceded the PrisonBall encounter, it was undoubtedly one of the finest athletic displays of 2012. It was so good in fact that there 3 lead changes during the total 11 games. Keeping in mind the already established groups, the addition of late arrivals Brent Bitsko, Charlie Podesta, Michael "Sputz" Krott, Grant Cornero, Tim Hart, and Diana DiBuccio sprinkled some extra seasoning onto this holiday treat.

Rounds 3, 5, 6, and 7 belonged to the first formed army; but "deuce" was wild, literally and figuratively, as games 1, 2, 4, 8, 9, 10, and 11 were captured by the victorious TEAM #2.

It's really no wonder ECD continues this yearly feast - everyone just yearns for that great taste of dodgeball!

TURKEY RECORDS
In all, there were a solid 23 competitors at THANKSKILLING, a turnout comprised of 19 men and 4 women. Matt Tangel was the only new participant; he received #506 as his player code number. Welcome to the big leagues, Matt!

2012 Year-end Statistics
◘ 23.2 average participants
◘ 21 new players, including #500 at SEVEN: THE ANNIVERSARY
◘ An average of 18.2 male and 4.7 female combatants per event
◘ Three venues for the first time ever - Wall High School, Ocean Road Park, and Orchard Park

THANKS"KILLING" History
History is no mystery especially on this cherished weekend. The Thanksgiving Holiday always brings out the best, and then some. Don't believe it? Check these out -
2005 | ORP One More Time
2006 | The Dark Days Have Begun
2007 | Wall, All 4
2008 | Megill, Adams II
2009 | Adams Era Feast-Off
2010 | Wall, All 11
2011 | Final Destination

___________________________________________________________

ONLINE EXCLUSIVE!
